      • kasiski

        public static int kasiski(java.lang.String text,
          int minKeyLength,
          int maxKeyLength)
        Performs the kasiski test in order to calculate the length of the key word used to encrypt a given ciphertext. Divides the text into its 3-character Substrings, and counts the number of occurances of each, storing each unique substring in a HashMap. After this, the distances between substrings with multiple occurences are calculated, and their factors are used to estimate the length of the keyword.
        Parameters:
        text - a string encrypted with a Vigenere cipher
        minKeyLength - the minimum length that may be returned for the key length
        maxKeyLength - the maximum length that may be returned for the key length
        Returns:
        the estimated length of the key used to encrypt the text
        See Also:
        estimateKeyLength(HashMap, int, int)

      • estimateKeyLength

        public static int estimateKeyLength(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> occurances,
                    int minKeyLength,
                    int maxKeyLength)
        Uses a list of Substring occurences found through the Kasiski test in order to estimate the length of a keyword. The most common occuring factor of the distances between reoccuring substrings is most likely the length of the keyword.
        Parameters:
        occurances -
        minKeyLength -
        maxKeyLength -
        Returns:
        the estimated length of the keyword for the ciphertext associated with occurances
        See Also:
        kasiski(String, int, int)
